poem:
The Waiting Resignation

A letter hidden in the desk drawer,
Unseen evidence of weariness,
Embers of a decision smoldering quietly.
McMaster stands in the shadow of power,
His patience a measured breath,
Until "Give me a date" bursts forth,
The final inhale before the storm,
And history inches closer to the edge,
With a sigh of desperation.
